prompt_init: You will receive a text. Your task is to rephrase this text without modifying its meaning. Just output your new text, nothing else. Here is the text:
prompt_update: You will receive a text. Your task is to rephrase this text without modifying its meaning. Just output your new text, nothing else. Here is the text:
initial_story: My observation is there exists unequal share of State monies with its residents, before all the Urban residents get defensive please hear me out. Presently no one except Corporations pay State income taxes. No individual pays state taxes. I noticed state funded bicycle paths, road maintenance, defunct Docks, powerful politicians pet projects such as office buildings, state troopers etc, etc. all these fundings and more are not necessary within City limits, I was amazed at how much our state provides city functions in the bigger cities thus growing the state budget, I saw on tv last night how adg&g was showing the little ones how to ice fish, couldn't the parents do that? yes I pay property taxes. But I will guarantee you once our City folk get the full bill with out the State monies we will not be as wasteful, on the office building...rent what space you need and help the office rental marked. In my business I just retired from,I would ask my managers, "how do you stop spending money"?
stories:
Here is the rephrased text:

I've noticed that the distribution of state funds among its residents is uneven. Before urban residents become defensive, let me explain. Currently, only corporations pay state income taxes, while individuals do not. I've observed that state-funded projects such as bike paths, road maintenance, and certain politicians' pet projects, like office buildings and state trooper services, are not essential within city limits. These projects, along with others, contribute to the state budget's growth, particularly in larger cities. I was surprised to see a recent TV program showing children how to ice fish, and it made me wonder why parents couldn't do that themselves. As someone who pays property taxes, I believe that if city residents were fully responsible for their own expenses without state support, they would be more mindful of their spending. For example, instead of building an office building, they could simply rent the space they need and help stabilize the local rental market. In my former business, I would ask my managers, "How can we reduce unnecessary expenses?"

For instance, instead of building an office, they could simply rent the necessary space and stabilize the local rental market. In my previous business, I would instruct my managers to identify and eliminate unnecessary expenses, a valuable approach that could be applied to city budgeting.

The allocation of state funds among its citizens is deemed unfair, as individuals are exempt from state income taxes while corporations bear the sole burden. I've noticed that state-funded projects, such as bike paths and road maintenance, are not crucial within city limits yet significantly contribute to the state budget's growth, particularly in larger cities.
